wikipedia_page.main: Lewis Gompertz (c. 1784 – 2 December 1861) was an English writer and inventor, early animal rights and veganism advocate, and a founding member, in June 1824, of the English Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals, later the RSPCA. He was the younger brother of the mathematician and actuary Benjamin Gompertz and the poet Isaac Gompertz.
